description.narrative: Facilitating Renewable Energy & Energy Efficiency Applications for Greenhouse Gas Emission Reduction (FREAGER)

activity-description.narrative: Facilitating Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

comment.narrative: 1.Recommended policy options for renewable energy and energy efficiency 2.a. 1x Demonstration of solar PV mini-grid systems 2.b. 2x Demonstration of micro/mini hydro grid 3.Provision of reference guide to initiate conversation with financial institutions 4.Provision of a data capture tool to aggregate PNG RE data. 5. Development of step-by-step guide for RE mini grid set up.

1. Gap analysis completed for renewable energy and energy efficiency policies. Commenced work on developing energy efficiency roadmaps and/or plans for four provinces. 2.a. Consultant engaged to support PNG Power Ltd to provide oversight over the design, procurement and installation of Samarai Solar PV mini grid. 2.b. Consultancy firm engaged to conduct feasibility studies and design 2xmini hydro projects in Eastern Highlands Province. 3. Yet to start development a reference guide to initiate conversation with financial institutions. 4. Yet to start review of RE data commenced to inform design of data capture tool. 5. Draft completed for step-by-step guide of solar pv mini-grid systems.

Activity Result 1: Energy Policy, Planning and Institutional Development Output 1.4: Formulated, adopted and effectively enforced standards to promote adoption of RE and EE. Targets: (1) Guidance developed to refine PNG national building code Draft Standards to improve national building code. (2) Guidance on the development of national standards of renewable energy equipment for community mini-grids.
Activity 2A: Enhanced technical-commercial viability and capacity in the application of energy efficiency technologies and development of feasible RE-based energy systems in the country.
Output 2A.1 Targets. (1) 20 selected technical personnel trained on costing, sourcing and technical aspects of sourcing and implementing pv mini grid projects. (2) 20 selected technical personnel trained on costing, sourcing and technical aspects of sourcing and implementing hydro mini grid projects (3) 20 selected technical personnel trained on building energy audits and building energy efficiency retrofits, including costing, sourcing, and technical aspects of preparing and implementing the retrofits. (4) 20 selected technical personnel trained on industrial energy audits and industrial energy efficiency retrofits, including costing, sourcing, and technical aspects of preparing and implementing the retrofits.
Output 2A.2 Targets. (1) Documentation of low-cost, high-quality products needed to construct micro/mini-hydro grids in PNG (2) Documentation of low-cost high quality products needed for building energy efficient improvements in PNG.
Output 2A.3 Target. (1) Information will be provided in the form of a user-friendly report with tables showing estimated cost break-downs for sample projects and tables listing “honest” price benchmarks for various cost components in PNG both for mini hydro and pv mini-grids.
Output 2A.4 Targets. (1) Designed curriculum for training O&M for micro/mini hydro projects. (2) Designed curriculum for for O&M for PV- mini-grid projects.
Output 2A.5 Targets. (1) Draft template and guidelines developed for power purchase agreement between PPL and owners of community-based RE mini-grids. (2) Negotiated draft PPA between PPL and Gatop Mini Hydro Station (3) Negotiated draft PPA between PPL and Kabwum Mini-Hydro.
Outcome 2B: Increased installed capacity of RE based power systems and implementation of viable EE technology applications in PNG.
Output 2B.1 Targets. (1) Design of a mini hydro generation in Gotomi (2) Design of a mini hydro in Miruma
Output 2B.3 Targets. (1) Township EE retrofit plans implemented for top users of electricity in Wewak and Maprik towns.
Output 2B.4 Targets. (1) Local people in Samarai, Gotomi and Miruma have developed altogether 15 productive uses.
Activity Result 3: Improved availability of, and access to, financing for renewable energy and energy efficiency initiatives in the energy generation and end-use sectors.
Output 3.4 Target. (1) Reference guide on funding sources available to RE and EE initiatives in PNG
Activity Result 4. Improved awareness of, attitude towards, and information about renewable energy and energy efficiency applications in the energy generation and end-use sectors.
Output 4.3 Targets. (1) Information on solar resource for Milne Bay is identified and captured in electronic format in a manner that is available for dissemination via internet. (2) Map of potential sites for micro/mini hydro in Morobe and Eastern Highlands Provinces (3) Interactive Map showing locations of PNG RE resource data already collected by other projects or organisations.
Output 4.4 Target. (1) Attractive materials for RE and EE developed expressly for primary and high school level and published on website available to public.
Output 4.5 Target. (1) Design and implement the promotion of RE and EE nationwide using five different medium.
Output 4.7 Target. (1) A ‘One-stop-shop’ website providing range of information on RE and EE in PNG is developed and housed in an appropriate location. Website will include range of materials related to RE and EE in PNG.

Activity Result 1: Energy Policy, Planning and Institutional Development Output1.4: Formulated, adopted and effectively enforced standards to promote adoption of RE and EE. (1) Report completed with recommendations to refine PNG national building code Draft Standards to improve national code. (2) Further consultations planned for Q1 2022 to finalize recommendations.
Activity 2A: Enhanced technical-commercial viability and capacity in the application of energy efficiency technologies and development of feasible RE-based energy systems in the country.
Output 2A.1 (1-4) All training activities planned for in 2021 have been delayed yet again due to Covid-19. Procurement of consultant is underway and training is now planned for Q1 & Q2 2022.
Output 2A.2 (1-2) Activity deferred to start in Q1 of 2022.
Output 2A.3 (1) Activity deferred to start in Q1 of 2022. However, the community handbooks provide some guidance on local suppliers.
Output 2A.4 (1) Completed update of the Technical Vocational Education Training (TVET) curriculum-syllabus for sustainable energy previously developed by SPC with funding from European Union. (2) Completed community handbooks for pv-solar, mini-hydro and energy efficiency.
Output 2A.5 (1) FORM F1C: Tripartite agreement form for an exclusive project development period at a site developed as part of Off-Grid Regulations. (2-3) PPAs to be negotiated after the adoption of the Off-Grid Regulations in 2022.
Outcome 2B: Increased installed capacity of RE based power systems and implementation of viable EE technology applications in PNG. Output 2B.1 (1) Completed design of a mini hydro generation in Gotomi (2) Completed design of a mini hydro in Miruma
Output 2B.3 (1) Implementation of township EE retrofit plans for top users of electricity in Wewak and Maprik towns were not possible as the ESCO fund with PPL was not established in time. This is deferred to 2022.
Output 2B.4 (1) Business consultants could not conduct stakeholder consultations with local people in Samarai, Gotomi and Miruma to develop productive uses due to criminal activities in Samarai and Covid-19 restrictions throughout PNG.
Output 3.4 (1) Reference guide on funding sources available to RE and EE initiatives in PNG not done. However, completed estimation of GHG emission reduction for sample Renewable Energy (RE) and Energy Efficiency (EE) initiatives.
Activity Result 4. Improved awareness of, attitude towards, and information about renewable energy and energy efficiency applications in the energy generation and end-use sectors.
Output 4.3 (1) Completed draft report presenting information on solar resource for Milne Bay. Draft GIS format is available for dissemination via internet. To be reviewed and completed in Q1 2022. (2) Completed draft report with map of potential sites for micro/mini hydro in Morobe and Eastern Highlands Provinces. To be reviewed and completed in Q1 2022. (3) Consultant engaged to develop interactive map showing locations of PNG RE resource data already collected by other projects or organisations.
Output 4.4 (1) Deferred to start in Q1 2022 - Attractive materials for RE and EE developed expressly for primary and high school level and published on website available to public.
Output 4.5 (1) Consultant engaged late in December 2021 to design and implement the promotion of RE and EE nationwide using five different medium. Expected to complete in Q1 2022.
Output 4.7 (1) Consultant engaged late in December 2021 to develop a ‘One-stop-shop’ website providing range of information on RE and EE in PNG is developed and housed in an appropriate location. Website will include range of materials related to RE and EE in PNG.

Activity Result 1: Energy Policy, Planning and Institutional Development Output 1.1: Completed Government Capacity Building Programs for the design and development of RE and EE technology projects Targets: 1. Officials of two national agencies, three provincial governments and 5 district planning agencies are trained on how to design and develop RE and EE technology projects. 2. 5 RE and 5 EE projects are identified, and concepts developed by participants of the training workshops. 3. 40% of officials trained are female
Output 1.2: Approved national - level policies or regulations that provide RE and EE. Targets: 1. Guidance on development of PNG off-grid electricity code. 2. Guidance on development of policies that promote community-based renewable energy mini-grids via ILG involvement. 3. Guidance on development of policies that promote EE in PNG
Output 1.3: National - level RE and EE roadmaps, with proposed funding allocations for projects submitted, approved, and implemented. Targets: 1. Guidance and draft of National Renewable Energy Roadmap for PNG. 2. Guidance and draft of National Energy Efficiency Roadmap 3. 4xProvincial Energy Efficiency Plans drafted and ready for promotion with relevant officials for adoption.
Output 1.4: Formulated, adopted and effectively enforced standards to promote adoption of RE and EE. Targets: 1. Guidance developed to refine PNG national building code Draft Standards to improve national building code. 2. Guidance on the development of national standards of renewable energy equipment for community mini-grids.
Output 1.5: Formulated, approved and implemented effective institutional plans for promoting RE and EE, detailing responsibilities of relevant agencies and coordinating mechanisms among them. Targets: 1. Draft Institutional Plan for PPL identifying areas for and recommendation to improve capabilities in supporting its customers to implement energy efficiency initiatives.
Output 1.6: Detailed adopted Provincial Plans for promoting RE and EE in townships (provincial and district centres) and villages including specific pipeline projects that will replicate the project demos. Targets: 1. Draft Provincial RE and EE Plans for Milne Bay, Eastern Highlands, East Sepik and Morobe Provinces that identify pipeline projects a possible funding sources.
Activity Result 2: Application of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Technologies Output 2A.1: Completed Capacity Building Program for technical personnel in the private and public sectors on the detailed technical preparation and implementation of community - based RE mini-grids and township EE Programs. Targets: 1. 20 selected technical personnel trained on costing, sourcing and technical aspects of sourcing and implementing pv mini-grid projects. 2. 20 selected technical personnel trained on costing, sourcing and technical aspects of sourcing and implementing hydro mini grid projects. 3. 20 selected technical personnel trained on building energy audits and building energy efficiency retrofits, including costing, sourcing, and technical aspects of preparing and implementing the retrofits. 4. 20 selected technical personnel trained on industrial energy audits and industrial energy efficiency retrofits including costing, sourcing, and technical aspects of preparing and implementing the retrofits.
Output 2A.2: Well-researched and verified sourcing information on RE and EE products including brands/specification, sourcing channels, and prices. information provided will cover low-cost, high quality products needed for pv mini-grids, micro/mini-hydro mini-grids, and various EE retrofits. Targets: 1. Documentation of low-cost, high-quality products needed to construct micro/mini - hydro grids in PNG. 2. Documentation of low-cost, high-quality products needed for building energy efficient improvements in PNG.
Output 2A.3: Detailed information on honest, best possible costing of community RE mini-grid projects. Costing will encompass feasibility study, civil works, electrical works, and construction services. Targets: 1. Information will be provided in the form of a user-friendly report with tables showing estimated cost break-downs for sample projects and tables listing honest price benchmarks for various cost components in PNG both for mini hydro and pv-mini grids.
Output 2A.4: Designed and trialed training program for developing capacity in O&M for RE mini-grid projects among local people and local officials in project areas, including certification program. Targets: 1. Designed curriculum for training O&M for micro/mini hydro projects. 2. Designed curriculum for O&M for PV - mini-grid projects
Output 2A.5: Proven system for power purchase agreements (PPAs) between PPL and independent power providers (IPPs) running community based RE mini-grids. Targets: 1. Draft template with guidelines developed for power purchase agreement between PPL and owners of community - based RE mini-grids. 2. Negotiated draft PPA between PPL and Gatop Mini Hydro Station. 3. Negotiated draft PPA between PPL and Kabwum Mini Hydro.
Output 2A.6: Adopted business plans for productive use of renewable energy (PURE) that raise the incomes of local people, especially women. Targets: 1. Local people in Samarai, Gotomi and Miruma have developed altogether 15 productive users
Output 2B.1: Completed successful demos of commercially viable mini-hydro systems in PNG. Targets: 1. Design of a mini hydro generation in Gotomi. 2. Design of a mini hydro in Miruma.
Output 2B.3: Completed successful demo of commercially viable township energy efficiency programs. Targets: 1. Township EE retrofit plan for top users of electricity in Wewak and Maprik towns.
Output 2B.4: Completed demonstration of productive applications of RE mini-grid systems that raise the incomes of local people. Targets: 1. Local people in Samarai, Gotomi and Miruma have developed altogether 15 productive uses.
Activity Result 3: Improved availability of and access to financing, for renewable energy and energy efficiency initiatives in the energy generation and end-use sectors. Output 3.2: Designed, funded, and launched special financing mechanism for EE projects. Targets: 1. Concept Note providing guidance on setting up an ESCO fund with PPL.
Output 3.3: Designed, funded and launched special loan fund for RE projects carried out by a PNG commercial bank Targets: 1. Concept paper on how to establish special loan funds with existing financial institutions and recommendations on alternatives (if any) to such arrangements.
Output 3.4: Publicly available information on sources of funding for RE and EE (eg. Green Climate Fund, crowdfunding, social impact funds, etc) including listing of sources and how-to-apply guide on effectively accessing funds. Targets: 1. Reference guide on funding sources available to RE and EE initiatives in PNG.
Activity Result 4: Improved awareness of, attitude towards, and information about renewable energy and energy efficiency applications in the energy generation and end-use-sectors. Output 4.1: Convincing, analytic and well disseminated briefing materials for policy makers showing that RE in many cases is more cost effective than fossil fuel in PNG and that EE projects bring strong benefits to businesses bottom lines. Targets: 1. Compilation of Information briefs and guidance on how to update these briefs for CCDA and DPE.
Output 4.3: Database on RE resources and pipeline RE projects in PNG. Targets: 1. Information on solar resource for Milne Bay is identified and captured in electronic format in a manner that is available for dissemination via internet. 2. Map of potential sites for micro/mini hydro in Morobe and Eastern Highlands Provinces. 3. Interactive Map showing locations of PNG RE resource data already collected by other projects or organizations.

Activity Result 1: Energy Policy, Planning and Institutional Development
Output 1.1: Completed Government Capacity Building Programs for the design and development of RE and EE technology projects. 1. One workshop held in Goroka for provincial and district officials on how to develop mini-hydro. Other training is postponed due to Covid-19 restrictions and delay in the development of curriculum and training material. 2. The identification of RE and EE project concepts have been delayed due to training workshops being postponed. 3. Yet to train female officials as planned due to training workshops being postponed.
Output 1.2: Approved national - level policies or regulations that provide RE and EE. 1. Completed Guidance on development of PNG off-grid electricity code. 2. Government priority required the development of specific policies for hydro and solar-based renewable energy. Inception reports were completed and work will continue in 2021. Consideration for ILG involvement will be discussed as well. 3. Work on developing the guidance note for policies that promote EE in PNG was delayed pending the completion of work on the National RE & EE roadmap.
Output 1.3: National - level RE and EE roadmaps, with proposed funding allocations for projects submitted, approved, and implemented. 1. Covid-19 pandemic disrupted in-country consultation meetings to inform development of a guidance note and draft of National Renewable Energy Roadmap for PNG. However, virtual meetings were held and work on this will continue in 2021. 2. Covid-19 pandemic disrupted in-country consultation meetings to inform development of a guidance note and draft of National Energy Efficiency Roadmap for PNG. However, virtual meetings were held and work on this will continue in 2021. 3. Covid-19 pandemic disrupted in-country consultation meetings to inform development of four provincial energy efficiency plans. However, virtual meetings were held and work on this will continue in 2021.
Output 1.4: Formulated, adopted and effectively enforced standards to promote adoption of RE and EE. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on developing a guidance to refine PNG national building code and draft standards to improve national building codes have been delayed. Now planned to complete in 2021. 2. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on developing a guidance to refine national standards of renewable energy equipment was delayed. Now planned to complete in 2021.
Output 1.5: Formulated, approved and implemented effective institutional plans for promoting RE and EE, detailing responsibilities of relevant agencies and coordinating mechanisms among them. 1. Covid-19 pandemic disrupted in-country consultation meetings to inform drafting of an institutional plan for PPL to improve capabilities in supporting its customers to implement energy efficiency. However, virtual meetings were held and work on this will continue in 2021.
Output 1.6: Detailed adopted Provincial Plans for promoting RE and EE in townships (provincial and district centres) and villages including specific pipeline projects that will replicate the project demos. 1. Covid-19 pandemic disrupted in-country consultation meetings required to inform drafting and adoption of provincial RE and EE plans in townships and villages that include specific pipeline projects. However, virtual meetings were held and work on this will continue in 2021.
Activity Result 2: Application of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Technologies Output 2A.1: Completed Capacity Building Program for technical personnel in the private and public sectors on the detailed technical preparation and implementation of community - based RE mini-grids and township EE Programs. 1-4. Not completed. All training planned were postponed due to Covid-19 restrictions and delay in the development of curriculum and training material.
Output 2A.2: Well-researched and verified sourcing information on RE and EE products including brands/specification, sourcing channels, and prices. information provided will cover low-cost, high quality products needed for pv mini-grids, micro/mini-hydro mini-grids, and various EE retrofits. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on documenting low-cost, high-quality products needed to construct micro/mini hydro grids in PNG was delayed. Now planned to complete in 2021. 2. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on documenting low-cost, high-quality products needed for building energy efficient improvements in PNG was delayed. Now planned to complete in 2021.
Output 2A.3: Detailed information on honest, best possible costing of community RE mini-grid projects. Costing will encompass feasibility study, civil works, electrical works, and construction services. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on producing a user-friendly report with tables showing estimated cost break-downs for sample projects and tables listing honest price benchmarks for various cost components in PNG for both mini hydro and pv-mini grids is now planned to complete in 2021.
Output 2A.4: Designed and trialed training program for developing capacity in O&M for RE mini-grid projects among local people and local officials in project areas, including certification program. 1. Curriculum for training O&M for micro/mini hydro projects is not complete and is urgently required in Q1 of 2021. 2. Curriculum for training O&M for PV-micro/mini grid projects is not complete and is urgently required in Q1 of 2021.
Output 2A.5: Proven system for power purchase agreements (PPAs) between PPL and independent power providers (IPPs) running community based RE mini-grids. 1. The templates with guidelines for power purchase agreement is pending the development of the off-grid code. The guideline for development of the code is now completed and work on the code will start in Q1 of 2021. 2. The negotiation for a draft PPA between PPL and Gatop Mini Hydro Station has not commenced due to a lack of the off-grid code and relevant legislation to guide negotiations. 3. The negotiation for a draft PPA between PPL and Kabwum Mini Hydro Station has not commenced due to a lack of the off-grid code and relevant legislation to guide negotiations.
Output 2A.6: Adopted business plans for productive use of renewable energy (PURE) that raise the incomes of local people, especially women. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work to develop 15 productive users in Samarai, Gotomi and Miruma altogether started late in 2020. Results are more likely to be achieved in 2021.
Output 2B.1: Completed successful demos of commercially viable mini-hydro systems in PNG. 1-2. Due to the Covid pandemic, consultants could not travel into the country to conduct field investigations. The Contract was then terminated and a new consultant was appointed in Q3 who had a local presence. Preliminary assessments by the second consultant show that critical topographic data is missing for both Gotomi and Miruma and requires further field investigations. Designs should be ready in Q2 of 2021.
Output 2B.3: Completed successful demo of commercially viable township energy efficiency programs. 1. Due to Covid-19 pandemic, the audit of Wewak and Maprik towns were delayed and the plans were not completed. These plans are now expected in Q1 of 2021.
Output 2B.4: Completed demonstration of productive applications of RE mini-grid systems that raise the incomes of local people. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work to develop 15 productive users in Samarai, Gotomi and Miruma altogether started late in 2020. Results are more likely to be achieved in 2021.
Activity Result 3: Improved availability of and access to financing, for renewable energy and energy efficiency initiatives in the energy generation and end-use sectors. Output 3.2: Designed, funded, and launched special financing mechanism for EE projects. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on developing an ESCO fund with PPL started late with the appointment of consultants.
Output 3.3: Designed, funded and launched special loan fund for RE projects carried out by a PNG commercial bank. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, work on developing a concept paper on how to establish special loan funds with existing financial institutions and recommendations on alternatives (if any) to such arrangements started late. Consultants were engaged in Q4.
Output 3.4: Publicly available information on sources of funding for RE and EE (eg. Green Climate Fund, crowdfunding, social impact funds, etc) including listing of sources and how-to-apply guide on effectively accessing funds. 1. Due to a lack of PMU support, the work on developing a reference guide on funding sources available to RE and EE initiatives in PNG started late with the appointment of consultants in Q4.
Activity Result 4: Improved awareness of, attitude towards, and information about renewable energy and energy efficiency applications in the energy generation and end-use-sectors. Output 4.1: Convincing, analytic and well disseminated briefing materials for policy makers showing that RE in many cases is more cost effective than fossil fuel in PNG and that EE projects bring strong benefits to businesses bottom lines. 1. Yet to develop information briefs and guidance on how to update these briefs for CCDA and DPE as this work is dependent on the completion of the outputs from Activity 1, 2 and 3.
Output 4.3: Database on RE resources and pipeline RE projects in PNG. 1-3. Due to a lack of PMU support all targets set for this output were not achieved. To be done in 2021 instead.
